biz.gabrys.lesscss.compiler2.loader

Interface FileLoader

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ClassPathFileLoader, FtpFileLoader, HttpFileLoader, LocalFileLoader

    public interface FileLoader
    Responsible for fetching content of the source files. // TODO extends description
    Since:
    2.0.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • isSupported

        boolean isSupported(String path)
        Tests whether this file loader supports a path.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to verify.
        Returns:
        true whether this file loader supports the path, otherwise false.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • normalize

        String normalize(String path)
          throws Exception
        Normalize a path. A normalized path is an absolute path where at least:
        1. all "." segments are removed
        2. if ".." segment is preceded by a non-".." segment then both of these segments are removed.
        Examples:
        • C:\data\projects\style.txt
        • /home/user/less/style.less
        • http://www.example.org/style.less
        Parameters:
        path - the path to normalize.
        Returns:
        the normalized path.
        Throws:
        Exception - if any error occurs.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • expandRedirection

        String expandRedirection(String path)
                  throws Exception
        Returns a direct and normalized path to a resource. Example: if a path is equal to "http://example.org/style.less", but this URL forwards to "/static/style.less", then the method will return "http://example.org/static/style.less".
        Parameters:
        path - the file's path.
        Returns:
        the direct path to the resource or null. null means that the path
        Throws:
        Exception - if any error occurs.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • fetch

        FileData fetch(String path)
        throws Exception
        Returns a data of a file specified by a path.
        Parameters:
        path - the file's path.
        Returns:
        the file's data.
        Throws:
        Exception - if any error occurs.
        Since:
        2.0.0
